result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Douglas Allen Fogle in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. in court for Douglas Allen Fogle.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary Hearing held.  State revokes its offer.
Officer Alexia Zac, MTPD, sworn and testifies for the State.
Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information will be filed today. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:29 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:01 am - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Douglas Allen Fogle appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. appeared by video for Douglas Allen Fogle. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 156070,
Payable Number: 157745,
Receipt Number: 22R 010527,
Amount: $20.00

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery (DVO).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-04-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with S.L.G., DOB: 03-30-1955.  Court will allow a one-time contact with the residence, with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement after 72-hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 48 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-11-2022
